author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Iyal Isai Nataka Mandram and the Department of Art and Culture will jointly organise the Ramayanam festival titled ‘Varna Kalanjiyam’ in the city from February 21 to February 27.

Renowned Carnatic musical exponents will present programmes such as Hari katha; dance drama; bommalattam; fusion music programme and pattimandram; all based on various sequences in the epic Ramayanam on all the seven days.

The festival will open at the Vijayaragavachariar hall on Cherry road at 10 a.m. on February 21 with Hari Katha on ‘Seetha Kalyanam’ by noted vocalist T. N. Seshagopalan and troupe.

Events

The other events to be held at 6.30 p.m. daily are dance drama titled ‘Ramayanam’ by Revathi Muthusamy and troupe from Srirangam on February 22; music drama ‘Kandaen Seethaiyai’ by Pudukottai Isaiyarasan troupe on February 23; dance drama ‘Rama Kathamrutham’ by Ambika Kameshwar troupe on February 24; bommalattam on the title ‘Sri Ramar Pattabishekam’ by ‘Mayiladuthurai’ M. Somasundaram troupe on February 25; fusion music performance, a combination of vocal, veena, flute, mridanga, gatam and ganjeera by P. Umasankar and troupe on February 26.

A pattimanram moderated by Gana Sirsabesan will be held on the final day on February 27, a release of B. Hemanthan, Assistant Director of Department of Art and Culture, issued here on Friday said.
title: Ramayanam festival from today
